_prev_prog_2.FR_OtherType: Applicable building, electrical, and plumbing codes. This facility complies with the Iowa Fertilizer Law.
_prev_prog_2.FR_Comments: We utilize those portions of these codes which are demed applicable by the jurisdictional authority
_prev_prog_2.MH_OtherType: Vandalism/theft (methamphetamines). Provisions have been made to install a protective barrier around the plant perimeter to reduce the potential of vehicular damage.
_prev_prog_2.PC_OtherType: Flow Limiters=what in the trade is called an excess flow valve. Breakaway couplers have been installed at the risers and a remote emergency shut-off valve at the storage tank.
_prev_prog_2.MS_OtherType: Regular plant inspections/Routine preventive maintenance & repairs
_prev_prog_2.EquipmentTested: Pumps, pump seals, pipes and plumbing, valves, electrical equipment, and safety equipment. The breakaway couplers, pressure relief valves, and hoses are also inspected and replaced as necessary.
_prev_prog_2.Description: The plan is to minimize those hazards to human health and to the environment that are associated with accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia. Employees working at the bulk storage plant make routine observations prior to and during transfer operations of the anhydrous ammonia from the storage vessel(s) to nurse tanks. In so doing, they are able to detect problems before they arise. This routine inspection identifies any portion of the system which may be under stress or about to fail. Repairs can be made before they become problematic. Employees are annually trained to recognize the hazards associated with storage and handling of anhydrous ammonia. In addition to annual training for employees who have been on the job for a number of years, the company conducts training for new hires. This training includes classroom instruction, on-site training at the plant, and follow-up observation to determine their individual comprehension and understanding of the new hire. Finally, the company routinely invites  local fire department personnel to visit the site. In the event that the local fire department requests assistance in training its employees on anhydrous ammonia, the company cooperates fully in their endeavors.

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Farmers Cooperative Company - Dike
Risk Management Plan
Executive Summary

1. Farmers Cooperative Company (FC) accidental release prevention policy involves, but is not limited to technologies, procedures, and management practices.  All applicable procedures of the Iowa Fertilizer Law are adhered to.  The emergency response policy involves the preparation of response plans which are tailored to each facility and to the emergency response services available in the community, and is in compliance with the EPA Emergency Response Program requirements.

2. The FC facility at Dike is in the business of selling anhydrous ammonia to farm customers as a form of nitrogen fertilizer.  The location includes anhydrous ammonia storage tanks, nurse tank filling risers, electrical panels and lighting, and anhydrous ammonia safety equipment.

3. FC's accidental release prevention plan is based on the following key elements:

* Annual training of all personnel required to handle ammonia and what to do in an emergency.

* Facilities constructed and maintained according to the Iowa Fertilizer Law.

* Use of usual anhydrous ammonia safety equipment.

* Use of effective operating procedures according to industry anhydrous ammonia safety procedures training material and training videos.

* Annual inspections by IDALS of storage tanks, piping for leaks, nurse tanks, applicators, transfer risers, riser hoses, safety equipment, pressure relief valves, etc.

* FC site inspections by safety committee members at least twice annually.

4. No accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia have occurred at this facility in the past five years.

5. This facility has an emergency response program, which has been coordinated with the Dike Fire Department, which is part of the Grundy County LEPC. This program includes a response decision tree and a notification plan.  Emergency operations plans and response procedures are reviewed annually, with a site visit of the facility by the Fire Department.

6. Chang
es to improve safety at this facility are completed as required by rule change and/or methods to increase safety and/or efficiency of operations.
